isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3200, 4100, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500, 8600 Models Built After 05/19/2003 - LIGHT SYSTEMS - PANEL LIGHTS - PANEL LIGHT OUTPUT FROM EGC

svcsubproc.title: Fault Detection Management

note.para: The testing method for troubleshooting the electrical systems portrayed in this manual is a basic voltage test. An alternative method of checking for voltage drops within a given circuit may be a quicker method of identifying an exact problem.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Panel Light Outputs from EGC.

A fault in the circuits between the EGC and the panel lights will be apparent when the lights don't operate correctly. There are no diagnostic trouble codes associated with the panel lights. Problems in the circuits between the EGC and the panel lights throughout the vehicle may be caused by burned out lamps, a short, an open, a blown fuse or a problem in the EGC.

Panel lights in the door pods are controlled by messages communicated between the EGC and the ESC on the drivetrain 1939 datalink and messages between the ESC and the door pods on the switch data link. Problems with the data links will cause more severe problems than loss of panel lights.

entry.para: There are no diagnostic trouble codes for panel light circuits.
Check with ignition key on, park lights on and fuse F9 removed. Press and hold the dimmer up button for 15 seconds to insure panel lights are at full intensity.

note.para: Always check connectors for damage and pushed-out terminals.

entry.para: (1011) fuse block 1, terminal C1 to ground.
If voltage is missing, check for open in circuit A62M or short in circuits A62N, A62C, A62E, or A62A.
If no shorts or opens are present, the ESC must be faulty.

para.emph: Panel Light Buss Bar (1002) Voltage Checks

entry.para: Check with ignition key on, park lights on, fuse F9 installed and buss bar cover removed.

note.para: If the fuse is blown check for shorts on circuit A62N and other circuits connected to the buss bar. Repair the short and replace the fuse.

entry.para: Press and hold the dimmer up button for 15 seconds to insure panel lights are at full intensity.

note.para: Always check connectors for damage and pushed-out terminals.

entry.para: Panel Light Buss Bar (1002) cavity A to ground.
If voltage is missing, check for open in circuit A62N. Insure fuse F9 is not blown.

svcsubproc.title: Extended Description
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Panel Light Outputs from EGC.

A variable voltage, controlled by the panel dimmer switch but generated in the EGC, is supplied at gauge cluster connector (1500) terminal 1 and circuit A62 to a tie point. At the tie point the circuit splits on circuit A62C to switch pack connector (1101) terminal C, circuit A62E to radio connector (1300) terminal F, circuit A62A to the HVAC control connector (1200) terminal A12, and circuit A62M to cab fuse block (1011) terminal D1 and 5 amp fuse F9. Voltage from the fuse is applied to circuit A62N to panel light adapter (1002). The panel light adapter is the source of panel light voltage for any other features with panel lights (except the door pods).
